intro: Calycadenia hispida, commonly known as the hispid calycadenia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it a rough texture. The flowers are usually yellow or white and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators.
